This ring feels nice most of the time. I was really disappointed by the lack of half sizes. I require a 7.5, but I had to buy an 8, which means the ring fits me loose. In normal circumstances this isn't a big deal, but when I am washing my hands, or taking a shower, the ring gets really slick, and I have had it come off a few times.

The ceramic portion of this ring is fantastic. It looks beautiful, and it extremely well-polished. I have gotten compliments from strangers on the beauty of it. However, since it is so well-polished in the inside, it does have a tendency to be sort of sticky. It's a bit difficult to explain, but if a very small amount of perspiration gets between the band and the skin, it's almost like a suction or vacuum which causes the ring to pull on the skin. It isn't painful or anything, just a bit uncomfortable, and is cause for constant adjustment, which then becomes an annoyance. This may also be due to the fact that it is a little too big for my finger.

The carbon fiber portion was unbelievably beautiful in the beginning. The criss-cross pattern of the fibers reflects light beautifully. The resin is completely transparent, and polished to high gloss, and so smooth and level with the ceramic that it is difficult to distinguish where it ends. There is very good craftsmanship in that. The problem is that it is resin, and so after a few months the scratches begin to build up, and the resin is no longer transparent. I have had this ring for three months, and it still looks good from a distance, but the resin is starting to take on a translucent quality from the scratched surface. Eventually the carbon fiber strands will be hidden behind the scratches, and will need to be polished.

With all of that said, this ring is still very much worth the money. After all, it is very inexpensive, and you can afford to buy a few of them now, to replace the ugly ones in the future.

I haven't experienced any chipping, cracking, or breaking, and the ceramic is extraordinarily difficult to scratch.
summary: Very Good Quality, But Buy a Few

reviewText: I'm very happy with this ring. It's not easy to see from the pictures but the embedded design has a bit of a 3D effect when you move it and the light hits differently. Very nice and noticeable (but not flashy).

Nothing really lasts long enough to be considered old but so far this ring has laughed at everything I have thrown at it. To date it has survived spray paint, acetone, grease, gasoline, soldiering iron, various hand tools, solvent products and gun cleaning brushes... Guess what? Still shining... I will update in a year but so far I am completely impressed.

Looks very nice and very durable. The round dome is comfortable. I bought this to use as a disposable ring for doing carpentry, painting, or working outside, but it has turned into my everyday ring. The ceramic is great because it won't scratch.

No back ache and after HOURS on my feet only a little ache and no where near as tired as I get after just a couple of hours with other shoes.  Wow is all I can say.  Will be buying more of this brand...just wish they weren't so expensive.  Over $100 for a wedge that is a little more dressy...and that would be my ONLY complaint about these shoes.

reviewText: I bought this band primarily because I put my hands in water a lot.  Each day, I clean my pool skimmer, I shower with the watch and I scuba dive.  This band is thick, comfortable and durable and a perfect fit for the Pebble Steel watch.  I found a 3/64 screwdriver on Amazon and use this screw driver for replace the band.  It is easy to do if you have the right size screw driver.  Even eyeglass screw drivers are too large so make sure to get the right size screw driver to do the job.  I liked the leather band that came with the watch, too, but if you are in the water a lot, get this one.  I see no flaws.  It has many grooves to fit small to large wrists and is classy enough for dress or casual enough to scuba dive or swim.  I highly recommend this band, especially if you are in the water a lot.
summary: Excellent Dive Band for the Pebble Steel, very durable and attractive design

This says it's it will fit the Moto360 and it probably will. However the pieces that fit inside the housing of the watch are too big and you really have to force them in there. I bought this as a band for my Moto 360. I got it mostly so that I can wear my Moto 360 during exercising since sweat doesn't mix well with the leather band that came with the watch.
Also I've been charged for extra US$ 30.00 they are now reviewing in order to reimburse me.

Ps.: Yhis does NOT come with a screwdriver for changing the bands, contrary to the pictures and the other companies that do include one.

The good:
Well made, high quality silicone.
Width and length about the same as the original leather band.

The bad:
The silicone band for some reason picks up a lot more dust than my other silicone bands. Not sure why that is.
The part of the band that connects to the watch are just a tad wider, so they don't fit into the grooves smoothly. Instead, you have to jam them in. The rod will slide through still and you can lock it in with a screwdriver. However, because it is so rigid in there, there is less flexibility and your watch will not lay flat on the table or desk when you set it down. The band will prop it up a bit.
Not easy to install.

Overall impression:
Pretty good band replacement for the Moto 360, but the connectors are a bit rigid and the band picks up too much dust.

reviewText:
Yes the actual length of the belt portion itself is around 31" inches instead of the 42.75" listed. If you add in the extender chain and put it on the last loop of that you'll have 42.75". Frankly this belt looks a little funny on the extender or even with it hanging down so I will be removing it. Based on the first measurements its perfect (on me) as a waist belt, especially for Ren costumes. It's doubtful this could be used as a hip belt or put through the belt loops of pants.

It looks prettier in person as well with a chain mail style with textured loops running along the center and plainer silver polished chain running along the sides. It has nice weight to it and does not feel as if it will fall apart any time soon. The lobster claw clasp is also big enough to easily fasten and feels secure. This is my first time ordering anything from NYfashion101 but based on the quality of this belt I consider some of the other things I saw from them on here.

This belt looks great. Especially on a little black dress. It's the perfect belt/accessory that doesn't stand out too much so it doesn't take away from the dress but really accentuates your curves and adds a nice touch to your outfit. I tried it with jeans but it looks much better with a dark colors dress.
I really like how there are three rows of rhinestones because its not too much flashiness but it is also not too little that people would not notice it.
I wore it out for a dinner with my husband and friends and it stayed on pretty well. I was a little skeptical that it would stay together because it seems very fragile. Even though there is three row of rhinestones it is still a very thin belt so I would be careful with it. I would really like to wear it to the club but I am afraid that it might fall apart or someone might accidentally get caught in it while dancing. Also, people could accidentally pull on it and I do not think it is strong enough to keep together from something like that.
The reason I can only give it four stars is that even after one use, one of the rhinestones fell out. Honestly, I am not 100% sure whether the rhinestone was already missing or if it fell out during my dinner out with my husband and friends. We really just went out and had a nice dinner so we did not do anything that would make it fall out so I am thinking maybe it was already missing from the beginning.
I would totally order this belt as it is a really nice addition to an outfit but my advice would be to check the belt as soon as you receive it to make sure all the rhinestones are there.
I received this item at a discount in exchange for my unbiased and honest review. I hope you guys have found this helpful :)
summary: Make sure that all the rhinestones are there as soon as you receive it!

I'm currently a 40A.  Finding a bra in that size that fits shallow breasts has become the Impossible Dream.  This bra is wearable and doesn't gap horribly, it's a good price, but it has enough shortcomings that I will not buy another one.

The straps are too short to cross in the back, which is what I wanted, because my shoulders slope and consequently my bra straps fall down.  I wouldn't want to wear it as a strapless bra because it doesn't have any extra stiffening or gripper elastic at the sides.  It's also so stretchy that I develop quad boobs--the bra slips up when I raise my arms and it stays there.  And it has a small sewing flaw.

reviewText: Wish it had a strap, wind constantly was blowing it away

Was given this hat as a hand-me-down last year, and it was the only one we've ever had that DS would happily keep on his head for hours at a time.  Not only that, but the sun blocking with it on was so good, I didn't usually have to go through the struggle of trying to get sunscreen on his face.  So, I decided to shell out the $24 with shipping for a new one this year.

Given the price, I decided to order a size up (a size 5 for my average sized 4 yo) so that we might get 2 yrs use out of it.  When it arrived, tho, it was not anywhere close to fitting, and was actually about the same size as the size 3 we already had.  According to the company's own size chart, it should have fit.  But I still had to return it at my own expense (another $4) to exchange for a size 6, which does fit.

This is one item where there is absolutely no benefit to ordering thru amazon.  Price + shipping is the same as direct from the company, and either way, you will have to pay return shipping to exchange if it doesn't fit.  The company was very nice and very quick about making the exchange once I sent it to them.  Five stars for the hat minus one for poor quality control and exchange policy.
summary: Runs small - order direct from UVSkinz

reviewText:
I bought this corset for practice before I made a massive investment in a higher quality corset. From the make I can tell this isn't meant for long time/long lasting wearing. From what I can tell it is two layers of fabric with and yes it is, steel bones but braided. The front busk is just plain steel. The fabric is a cotton polyester blend with no canvas or trill middle or lining which a true corset has. The cotton poly blend substitutes but isn't nearly as strong or long lasting. The bones are very flexible but when you have it on and laced you can't bend it nearly as well. You actually have to put in effort.
I've worn it three days as a part of seasoning
Day one loose for two hours
Day two tighter but still loose for two or threehours a break and another 4 (not recommended)
Day three (today) just put it on.
It has formed to my body VERY well and?pretty fast. When I first wore it it was very stiff and a little uncomfortable and I honestly thought I had bought the wrong size because I had loosened it a great deal(about a four inch gap). but day two it had felt more relaxed against my body and I didn't have as many issues with tightening it in the back. I tightened about two more inches in from the day before(btw I replaced the ribbon with heavy duty lacing). So far I have had no issues with fraying, bones poking out, seams coming loose etc... it's held up pretty well. When I laced it up this morning I was actually able to lace it were the middle was only an half inch apart; the top and bottom gap at my hips and ribs are about an inch and half or so.
So far so good. Anyone wondering my measurements I wear a US L. 14 pant. 36DD. I bought a xL3. I'm 5'5" 170lbs. This corset has no selioet. Its just straight with curves at the top and bottom for you hips and ribs which is why I gave 4stars. I would recommend to anyone who?wants the practice.
summary: Meant for practice long detailed review

The cost being: ($7.50 if you still have the invoice) or more (I was quoted $14.27 for USPS). *the cheapest rate I could find to return this item. (half the cost of the top itself).Unbelievable.
With sizing this far off they need to provide free returns.
Charging for returns that are this likely to be necessary, is really shameful & dishonest business practice  & I will NEVER buy from Roamans again. You're just throwing money in the trash if it doesn't fit & their incorrect sizing makes it so most customers will require a return.
I have to add that the top itself is very cute & fabric is so soft. If it fit properly it's probably a really nice top; making this even more of a disappointment. Would buy again if not for Roamans horrible return policy on major sizing issues.

reviewText:
Since high school I've always worn FOTL boxer briefs and was always satisfied. Unfortunately recently the company decided to change their sizes and what constitutes S, M, or L. I've always wore M. Their new batch of M were much smaller. At that point I decided to make the switch to boxer shorts. First pair I bought were Tommy Hilfiger and the transition to full boxers went off perfectly. They were comfortable and fit nicely. I decided to return to FOTL but with boxer shorts this time. I can tell you they are not as well stitched as the Tommy's. Also the material is very thin. Even though I got the colors they are almost transparent. And the last issue which is a crucial one (and I hope FOTL reads this review) is sewing a button on the fly. With an open flap your member will always be poking his head out at the most inappropriate times.
Other than that they are true to size and for the most part pretty comfortable.

Great bag for the price, although shipping was a bit expensive. reviewText:
I ordered this set after looking so many designs as i wanted something exclusive and convinient to differ them easily when so many bags are coming simultaneously at airport.
When I look it in picture and immediately i found that it will solve both purpose.
I got them few days back in very well condition and by look i can say that its wheels are really very sturdy and easy going.
Also it has the solution of the problem of not getting close after packed like previous hard shell baggages. It has extra lenghening zipper.
Now any more i can say after doing any trip so i will update afterward also.
But I think I make a good deal with price as stores have very high prices for regular type of luggage also.
Update:
After almost one full year, i had a chance to use carryon bag at my hawaai trip. When i started packed it, i surprised that how much stuff i can put inside it..!!
Although i packed summer cloths which r small in size and weight but i was able to pack my 10 day clothes and other stuff which was amazing..!! Actually then I didn't need to take another luggage.:-)
It holds grt as it is a carryon bag so it was handeled by me but very convinient to handle it bcz of its light wt.

I rolled the dice and bought these for my new I/O goggles. I owned Red Sensors before and liked them, but didn't feel they brightened up the snow enough in flat lighting with the rose tint. Considered the Blue Sensor, but it has the same base tint so I figured it would have a similar look. Noticed the Yellow Sensor Mirror Lens and started to research it, and found nothing about it, even Smith's website only lists the VLT (65%). So let me tell you this is a yellow tinted lens with the blue sensor mirror to reduce glare, if you prefer a yellow tint in low light, this is your lens. I'm glad Smith released a high quality Yellow tinted lens for the I/O, works like a charm in flat light and I can finally see definition in the snow before I'm right on top of it!
summary: Great flat light lens for those who prefer a yellow tint

I don't think Ive ever had a leather bracelet fit this well. The shade of blue on the cut side of the strands is a darker, deep, rich turquoise. Its hard to open the clasp, but Im sure that will get easier with time. This bracelet goes well with various outfits. I can wear it with jeans and a tee, or a dressier look if I want to soften the formal feel. This is my 5th (or maybe more) purchase from Les Poulettes, and Ive returned one item, but Ive never had to contact them. I love this brand.
summary: Versatile and fits small to medium wrists well

First - for flying I love this bag.  My wallet and phone can fit in the outer zipper pocket, the interior is simple and roomy, and the side compartments fit large water bottles - which is very important to me.  A month ago I would have rated this higher, but today one of the brass "feet" popped off and what was left was an incredibly dangerous two pronged spike.  Dug into my leg and luckily a kind aiport employee offered me some duct tape until I could find a way to work it out of its hole.  I've used this bag maybe 4 times.  If the foot had fallen off without danger to injury I would have been disappointed, but not concerned.  I will have to look for a different option for the future:(

Exterior fabric seems sturdy. I love that it has feet on the bottom. The padded pocket just fits my Lenovo think pad. The padding is only on the inside side of the bag- not padding to protect it from the outside of your drop it or it gets banged around. The depth of the interior small pockets are a little silly and they lack closures. I wish it had pen holders. The side interior and exterior pockets are nice for bottles, umbrellas and such. I like that there is a luggage strap to put on your roller bag, but it isn't the nice kind that has a zipper/zippers in case you just want to use it as another pocket.
I am mildly concerned about the apparent lack of reinforcement at the handle/strap attachments, as I sometimes need to lug around a lot. There is another ridiculous shallow open pocket on the exterior, and a zippered pocket as well. It's nothing fancy or expensive-looking, but I got it for hopefully its durability, since my awesome Tutilo bag's strap tore. On a final note, I was not sent the shoulder strap, which is why this is not 4 stars.

update- they did send me the missing strap.  Also, the handles have finally pulled away from the bag (not torn completely off, but def going to break soon).  Not bad for the price- lasted almost 2 years.
summary: Exterior fabric seems sturdy. I love that it has feet on the ...

reviewText:
Like so many others, I bought these as part of my New Years resolution. I wore these every day in real-life situatiins and now that I have some time under my belt with them, here is my unbiased review:
Fit and Finish - They run small as others have stated, so I added a couple X's to my normal size and they fit fine. The paper they use is sturdy, but stiff and feels like thick construction paper. Also, the tape they use to hold this origami masterpiece together grabs any tiny hairs that are present. I would suggest a full waxing if you want to use these long term.
Usefulness - This is where it really earns 5 stars. Since underwear is the only clothing that really needs to be washed, I have been able to sell my washer and dryer; saving hundreds on my water bill. When you are done using a pair, you don't have to throw them out either. They can easily be up-cycled and given to the kids to color on and make paper airplanes, used as a coffee filter the next morning, staple the leg holes and it makes a nice lunch sack, the possibilities are endless! Lifehack! I found them useful while in the office also. A co-worker spilled his coffee across the desk, I quickly reached down my pants, tore off my paper loin towel, soaked it up before it could damage his laptop, and squeezed it back into his mug before he could say "thank you". I have also used them as an impromptu notepad during a board meeting, and I could tell the others were all impressed by my ingenuity.
Auditory - These give a nice rustle to your hustle, and makes me reminisce about walking through piles of leaves on a cool fall day.
All in all, a great product regardless of all the paper cuts.

Fantastic! I purchased the 30 pack of briefs for a 7 day trip to Mexico. I wore one on the flight and took 10 pairs with me. I brought home 3 unused. They held up without a hitch thru a week of walking, dancing, swimming and just hanging around the bar with other travelers.  The fit was perfect for me - I am a small guy and purchased the small size. Snug and comfy around the legs and waste, with no bunching or riding up. And they are comfortable, almost commando comfortable whilst providing good support.

The briefs take up next to no space in my luggage, leaving room for other items and if you are only carrying a small carry-on, I don't see how these can be beat. Wear them. Throw them away and don't bring home dirty underwear.

This is really good underwear! It looks small at the first glance, but it is actually flexible. When I try it on, it simply fits as expected! BTW, since there are 30 in a single pack, it is really a good deal! Thanks a lot!
Buy one size up at least. Excellent for travel!

reviewText:
Watch arrived without instructions (which I expected, based on other reviews). It was easy enough to set up, and the buttons were more responsive than my other referee watch.

However, within a week of receiving the watch, it started resetting the date and time on its own.

After two weeks, the watch completely died. Changing batteries didn't help. I'm disappointed by the poor quality.
summary: It was easy enough to set up

reviewText:
Well I read the reviews and saw many negative ones as well as some positive ones. I decided to take a chance that the production quality control varied so much that some people got the better quality result, some the poor quality ones and perhaps I'd get a good one.
I hit the reverse jackpot and pretty much had all the negative issues. I used it for one day. No knocks, bangs or drops. Just regular games and treatment. Other than having to interpret from instructions that as people have mentioned seem to be a word for word translation of 4000 year old kanji symbols uncovered by archeologists in remote caves, and the semi-intuitive button actions I worked like a charm. One cross country meet where I used and recalled 8 split times and seven youth soccer games went by without incident. Then the next day I reached for it and:
- The glass was fogged
- The display had faded to unreadable
- No response from any button
After a day and a half of leaving it in the house to see if it would recover it's just the same.
I'm *slightly* temped to purchase another on the basis that I got the awful quality dud so maybe I'd get a good one. One balance it's a no way.

You can take a chance like I did, and if you do I hope you get a good one.
On the other hand there are enough negatives for that to be a big risk.
For the functions and price point it's a great concept. In practice it's almost certainly not going to work for you.

**UPDATE**
Now about an hour or two after getting it to check before writing the review it has started beeping randomly. At first there would be long pauses but now it's happening between 2-3 times per second and every 5 seconds.
Wondering what it will come up with next before it gets picked up for the return journey...
summary: I took a chance and lost. Returning after using for 1 day.

reviewText:
I absolutely love the style of the jacket and plan to keep it and make it work, however there are several drawbacks.
1. The fit is WAAAY off! I typically wear a small in shirts (37,25,34) and a Large in this jacket is still too snug to zip.
2. The arms are extremely short, you can clearly see my watch (about 3 inches of my wrist are exposed).
3. The jacket is super short. It does NOT even hit the belt line in a pair of low-rise jeans (and I have a short torso). If you have a longer torso, this will be a mid-rift jacket
4. The denim is cheap. Its not the heavier denim like in a pair of standard jeans- its more of the "jegging" (denim legging) material
5. It really did take a month to receive.
With all that said, I paid $20-something dollars for it, so I really wasn't expecting for the jacket to be of the highest quality...

Also, on the listing of the jacket, it may say the color is "Red Brown," "Dark Brown," or something else. Just pay attention to the picture. What you see in the picture is what you get. This is the case with the other colors of this jacket, as well. It's a very stylish jacket, and also very slim. I don't suggest buying this jacket if you are overweight or obese.

The Flamingo scarf is very soft. It is also long enough that you can chose to wear it in my different styles. It is a light pink with the flamingos in a light gray. I recommend this item and would also recommend the seller. No problems.  A fun scarf to wear! I took it to Las Vegas and it just brightens up your outfit.
This scarf is the full, soft and billowy type...and its beautiful!
Fast shipping and beautiful scarf.

I ordered this dress knowing there might be issues with fit or delivery speed, but was surprised to find issues with the actual pattern and colors of the dress. I posted images so buyers will know what exactly they are getting, and how it differs dramatically from the posted picture. The top portion looks nothing like the image, and is very disjointed from the bottom. The skirt is more blue and orange, instead of the purples, yellows and ivories displayed. The pattern edges bleed into one another, instead of being crisp and defined like shown. In terms of fit, the waist line sits a good 3 inches above the belly button, so it is a very awkward proportion, almost child-like. The material feels like a cheap table cloth, but they did descrbe it as "chemical fibre" so I wasn't expecting much. I gave it 1-star for these reasons (-1 star each for color, pattern, fit, and material), there is nothing I like about the dress I actually received.
summary: Do not be deceived, item is not as pictured

reviewText: Love it! Nice color and very good quality.

My daughter does a  home sales business and lot of people at her last convention had on chunky jewelry.  She had mentioned she really wanted to get some chunky jewelry to amp up her look for shows etc.  When I saw this bracelet, I immediately thought of her and what she was looking to do with her style.  It comes with an adorable bag that has a draw string.  It was not in the bag when it arrived the bag was seperate but I really liked that because it is going to allow me to put some of the extra confetti like stuff in the bag with it to give to my daughter as a gift.  There are very specific cleaning and care instructions on the listing for this item.  I highly recommend you use them if you purchase this bracelet.  I did notice that someone had posted previously that they had an issue with the color running.  I think that is probably why the instructions are listed.  In case you can not find them they are below:
Tips to Maintain your accessories:
1) Avoid direct contact with heat, or expose under the sun.
2) Before showering, take out the accessories and keep it in a safe place.
3) Avoid solvents or chemicals like perfume or soap. Dry it with a clean towel if gets wet.
4) Clean in a secure location, not the rim of a sink where a piece may slip down the drain.
5) Use only a soft brush, never sharp or hard objects, to remove dirt or particles.

Keep in mind items that you may use like perfume etc may have alcohol or other agents in it to 'scent' the perfume and may create issues with any jewelry you put on.  I try to make sure my perfume has had time to dry before putting anything on where I have applied it.

Overall the bracelet is gorgeous.  It is also very sturdy and I am very happy with my purchase as well as the superfast shipping speed!

I did recieve a discount on this product in exchange for an honest review, however, as I am typing this, I do notice the pricing I paid is the same as the sale price listed for the public.  I don't know if that will change but I did want to make sure anyone reading my review was aware of that.
summary: Beautiful bracelet - do take care to read the care information on the listing.

Not only for the waste of time, but for the waste of money for the bracelet.  It should be noted that the bracelet is NOT waterproof!  It's just painted.  I was so disappointed because it looked so nice until all the color ran off!

This is a handsome looking watch, make no doubt about it, both in pictures and in person.  I was nervous about many things with this watch, especially buying overseas, but they were all placated once I received the watch.  It came in a simple box with a pillow, but no instructions.
 - The crown is a screw-in kind, but the second hand does not stop when you pull out the crown all the way to set the time.
 - It keeps time pretty accurately, haven't measured it exactly to the minute though, but it hasn't really gone too far ahead or behind in the 4 days I've owned it.
 - It doesn't look too big on the wrist, in fact it looks really good.  The case height is relatively high but I can fit it underneath my shirt cuff just fine
 - The strap is nice and the clasp is just okay - it's kind of awkward to set up, but it is nice to have a clasp.
 - The bezel rotates counter-clockwise.  I have seen a few videos where the bezel has been messed up in one way or another with a Parnis, so I was nervous mine might not align perfectly at the 12oclock position or it would be too loose, but it ratchets quite nicely, and lines up perfectly.
 - The movement is a 21 jewel Miyota movement (which I assume they mean Citizen?), and it works fine - I estimate 4-5 ticks per second, so it isn't the smoothest in the world, but it also definitely gives the effect of a smooth ticker just fine.
 - The weight to wind the spring is a bit loud - not louder than the vents in my office, but in a quiet room you can hear it for sure.  I can't hear it when it's in the watch winder though.
 - The crystal is sapphire, which is very nice

The seller was great to me as a customer with my myriad questions and it arrived in 12 days from China.  Just awesome all around!
summary: A great watch for the money!

reviewText:
Nice pendant. Chain is too short to put over your head. I had ordered this for someone who was in the Army for 14 years, but he didn't reply to my messages that it arrived. I gave it to my boyfriend. He loves it & said the chain isn't too short to wear it comfortably. I'll update with the exact measurements when he takes it off. Please keep in mind that the ball chain is the same chain used in bathtub drains & ceiling fan pulls, but don't let that keep you from buying this. The loop on the pendant is quite large & can accommodate many other chains or cords. I don't know if it will chip or turn his skin green yet. It's a bit pricey with the ugly chain, but we love the pendant. I recommend this for men, not ladies, only because the pendant is heavy, but I highly recommend it for anyone that plays the GTA series of games because you get to throw hand grenades & you get stars when the police are chasing you lol.
I also recommend it for anyone that is or was in the Army because I did a search for Army symbols & Army jewelry & this is the only one that I liked.
It arrived in a small zip baggie with the pendant beside, not on the chain, inside a square bubble lined white envelope approximately 6" x 6". Much faster than several other companies in China.
summary: Ordered 7/7 arrived 7/21 much sooner than estimated

All-in-all, a good buy.

reviewText: good

I am pleasantly surprised by this top, mostly because I think the collar is absolutely adorable. I wasn't sure how it would look on me, but I really like it. The sleeves also fit perfectly--it is narrow enough in the shoulders for me, and the way they are cut with two overlapping pieces will allow for many different sized arms. I normally wear a medium in shirts--sometimes petite large if there is no stretch in the bust--and I am happy with a medium (US 10) in this top.

There are some cons, however (although not enough for me to want to return it). The fabric has no stretch whatsoever, and I find it a bit snug in the hips and chest. The chest I expected, as I frequently have this problem--and since it doesn't stretch I find it bunching up under my arms/above my bust, and have to pull it down. BUT I still find it very wearable, as it does lay very nicely when I pull it down. The hips I was more surprised, as relative to my torso I have relatively narrow hips. If you have wider hips/a more hourglass figure, you will want to size up even more than I did, or expect to wear it more bunched up at your waist.

The fabric is pretty soft, but it's a sheer mesh (except for the collar and the trim on the sleeves, which are opaque). So you definitely need a cami underneath.

In real life, the seam on the skirt is a simple overlock, not folded like in the picture.

It's a very cute suit - I don't intend to swim with it, but mostly plan to use it for activities where I'm exposed to water and might get wet - like kayaking in warm weather, or simply strolling around beach area, and I'm wearing something that can get wet and not feel like I need to cover up if I'm strolling around afterwards.

This suit is like a comfortable "summer dress" and it will fulfill its intended purchase purpose.

Hope this review helps you!

This style of Brooks running shoe (Adrenaline GTS) has been worn by both of my boys (ages 11 and 9) for one whole year.  The mesh has worn through on the sides.  One son was diagnosed with plantar fasciaitis, and the other son started to get shin splints after his runs.  We were recommended to get something with arch support or buy custom arch support inserts.  We went with the first option.

They no longer have any feet/foot pain like before, and the shoes have survived daily sports activities on the recess yard (soccer, basketball, baseball) for the past year.  We just picked up these black Adrenaline GTS 15 in a bigger size because the boys feet have finally grown out of the shoes.  I would highly recommend them for their comfort, durability, and design.

We opted to get some no-tie sport laces for these pairs because they wanted a faster way to get in and out of their shoes, a pop of color, and prevent any further delay in their activities because they have to stop to tie their laces.

reviewText:
The watch is exactly as pictured.  I like the band very much.  It states it is rubber but it looks and feels like flat black linked aluminum.  It is not your typical rubber band.  Very comfortable and has easy on and off clasp.

It is a good looking watch for anyone that likes both analog and digital functions in one.  The watch is much lighter than it looks.  There is a piece of orange plastic just under the bezel that cheapens the look a bit.  The bezel edge is raised slightly which protects the crystal.

The accuracy is incredible for such an inexpensive watch.  In 12 days neither the analog or digital portions of the watch have lost even one second.  In comparison, I have an inexpensive Walmart watch which, in the same amount of time, has lost 7 seconds on the analog and gained 7 seconds on the digital portion.  I used the Atomic Clock as the reference.

so.. after reading many reviews I knew enough to buy a few sizes bigger (normally I am a size small, 5'5" 110lbs, size C-D bra) and I bought a large and am happy I did. The fit would be too small if I had bought any smaller. I like how the neckline and underarm area doesn't drop too low, so it's easy to wear a strapless bra with it and not worry about it showing. Really, the only reason I'm giving it 4 stars out of 5 is because I had to trim some of the lining on the inside of it (hard to explain, but on the inside of the tank top, in between the lining and the outer shell there is a stitch line that connects the black "v" top to the white and you could see too much of the black material through the sheer white part. Anyway, it took about 15 minutes to trim away the excess black material so it wouldn't show through on the outside. I apologize if that doesn't make a whole lot of sense, but basically now that I finished it, it's definitely wearable and my cutting won't fray because I trimmed outside of the actual stitch they had. In the end, it's probably on the caliber of forever 21 (not well made) but when I put it on, somehow it still can pull off the fancy look and because of its unique style, I felt like it was worth it in the end. It's an adorable top, I'm looking forward to wearing it on a date night with pretty earrings and a bracelet
summary: size C-D bra) and I bought a large and am happy I did

Size 26 fit my 5'6, 125 pound, smallish backsided frame exceptionally well. There was no bunching up of material at the yoke, but there is enough stretch to the fabric that these jeans would be able to accommodate someone who was a tad more blessed in the tushy department than me.
After a nine hour work day that involves a great deal of walking and movement the jeans kept their shape and fit. This is a big plus in my book as cheaper slim fit jeans with stretch to them tend to lose shape and sag at the back side and in the thighs as my day goes on.
Would have been a perfect 5 star rating if not for the stray (contrasting) threads that needed to be cleaned up. It was a minor annoyance that was easily fixed with a few quick snips of the scissors. Other than this the quality is exceptional.
* They are true to size - measure your waist, and order accordingly. There is no need for sizing up or down.

I normally wear a band size of 32-34, so I ordered a 34. However, the band size on these bras was much larger than my current 34 bras (I measured -- it was between 2 and 3" longer than my current 34s). I returned the 34 and bought a 30 instead. It fit fine in the band and cups, but I'd ordered a different brand in 34, and they were the same length as the 30s in this brand. While others have had different experiences with the sizing being accurate (according to the reviews), be prepared for some fit adjustments on the smaller band sizes (I tried on all 6 in case it was a fluke with one, but they all were big). Love that this product had free return shipping, though, and I was able to get the exchanged size very quickly. Excellent deal for 6 bras, definitely!

Edited to add:  I'm very pleased with these bras. The other brand I'd ordered ended up coming apart (cheaply made). These bras were even less expensive than the other brand, but have held up very well. I will be ordering more, for sure, just in a small band size.

reviewText: I wanted a lightweight summer scarf to cover my chest and shoulders from the sun. The design and colors on this scarf are very pretty. The fabric is OK for an inexpensive scarf, a bit "cheese-clothy" and prone to catching on things. The real problem were the edges, really badly stiched. I washed it by hand, and it didn't bleed or shrink, which was nice. I wouldn't recommend washing it in a washing machine or drying it in a dryer. It is not a terrible purchase overall, but I wouldn't buy it as a gift, those edges make it look even cheaper than it is.

The colors and print are lovely (I got the "sky" version)!  For the price, this is exactly what I expected. Unless you have an allergy, I'm not sure why you'd care what this was made of. It's soft and drapes nicely - plus, it's thin so it will be easy to wear even in warmer weather.  With prices like this, you can buy a TON of scarves!

I love scarves and with a minor addiction I try to keep the cost of what I purchase under $10.  For the cost this scarf was lovely.  I know the previous reviewer mentioned the material... unless you're particular about that it's no big deal.  I personally didn't even pay attention to that fact.  I find the print lovely, the scarf is quite large and can be worn a number of ways.  It was a great addition to my collection.

reviewText:
Love this purse! It has two zipper pockets (one on the inside and one on the outside). Cheetah print fabric on the interior. Fits nicely over the arm. Simple design. Fun feel.

There were some reviewers on here who complained about the price of this purse... which was very puzzling to me. After searching for purses that ranged from $20-$300 at my local department and discount stores, this seemed like a really good deal (not to mention exactly what I wanted). The purse is probably worth $35 and the fact it has Marilyn Monroe on it is all the more reason to spend a mere $10 more.

Note: Try to view the wallet as just an "extra" for buying the purse. Thankfully, I only had the purse in mind when I purchased this item. The wallet is OK, but nothing to get too excited about. Other than having several compartments to organize credit cards and such in... there's not much else to say about it. But who cares about the wallet? It's the purse that's going to get all the attention! :)

reviewText:
I purchased several of these to wear as a summer base layer under my cycling jersey. Even in the hottest weather, I prefer wearing something under my jersey to transfer perspiration, and to protect my skin from bugs and sun, when I unzip my jersey for cooling. Snug fit with no annoying folds and wrinkles to chafe are essential, and these fit my skinny upper body perfectly. I'm 5' 11' and weigh less than 150 lbs. The medium size fit me perfectly, and they are long enough to fit comfortably into my cycling shorts giving smooth wrinkle free summer base layer. They were on sale on Amazon and less than half the price of similar shirts from Louis Garneau, Nike etc. My only objection was the limited choice of colors, and they were not available in white, which I prefer.
Caveat: If you have a bulkier body type, you might find the snug fit of these uncomfortable -- but you would have the same issue with much more expensive shirts from companies like L-G and Body Armor. Also, these shirts contain Lycra which requires more care in washing and drying.
summary: Bargain summer base layer for cyclists. Not available in white or I would buy a few more.

reviewText: Of the three watches I bought this one came with an extra battery! Yay! But no box. Booooooo.

This is a nice fashion watch.  The leather band is really thick and sturdy.  The watch came packed with an extra battery, which will be nice later on down the road when it comes time to replace the original one.  The watch has a good weight, but isn't heavy.  The outer most buttons are just decoration and do not serve any function.  My wife liked the darker colors of the watch.

The only downside I see with the watch, is that getting to the back of the watch will take a little bit of work to be able to change the battery.  It seems to keep good time, and with the thick leather band I believe that the watch will last for some time.

* I received this product at a discount in exchange for my unbiased, honest review.  This in no way altered my opinion of the product. *

I'd been looking for a relatively inexpensive watch in a particular style, I needed a large face and something not as delicate as most womens watches tend to be. In the past I have lent towards mens watches to get a band that fits and a larger face.  This watch covered all the basics. I pretty much figured the band wouldn't fit, I was pleasantly surprised.  Sure it is on the last hole, the leather of the band has a fair bit of give in it and with regular use will be as comfy as my fave pair of shoes.  This was really does offer a lot of bang for the buck.  It comes with a small plastic clip on the inside of the winder, I figured I would have to wind it regularly, yet I haven't. Once I removed the clip it started ticking away, it was easy to set the time.  The only note of interest really is that the band covers the back of the watch, so changing a battery might present a challange without  resorting to cutting the band out there.  Overall I am really happy with my purchase.

reviewText: I have a 42" hip measurement. I wear between a size 10-12 dress. I bought the XL.  In swimwear, I tend to order up cause no one wants unsightly and dreaded "muffin top." I was a little concerned about how much booty I would be showing with these bottoms but I decided to take a chance. They most certainly cover everything. There are no issues for me. The ties are long enough that I can tie little bows instead of having them dangle on the sides. Because of the ties, I have averted the "muffin top" crisis. I would absolutely recommend Freya brand to anyone that will listen. Their products are very well made. They also cater to real gals with real chests. I only wear bikinis cause it's the only way I can mix and match tops and bottoms to get the right kind of support and coverage. Freya also makes small band with large cup bras/bikinis with realistic support. I have a 31" rib cage but alot of boob. (I wear a 32FF). People think shopping at "plus size" stores fixes the problem. It doesn't when the smallest band they carry is 34". I also am young so I like feeling stylish. Freya most certainly fills that need. :)
summary: These are UK sizing, check the size chart

Edit 4/21/15
I purchased the Deep blue version (again short sleeved) and the navy skirt is at least an inch longer than the pink one AND fits my 36in hips rather than my 29in waist and I ordered the same size (XL). It means either the pink is meant to be smaller or they have listened to reviews and made them longer. But given the quality of this outfit I'd say it varies by the color you purchase. I'm actually much more pleased with the deep blue than I am the pink though just because I can wear the skirt to a con with out attracting unwanted attention.

First of all, get one - two sizes up. It's in Asian sizes, so it's small. I'm 135 lbs and usually a medium, but I got a large and it was still a little bit small in the length of the shirt. I probably should have gotten an XL. The bow is detachable and you attach it to the shirt yourself with the safety pain it comes with. I don't know if it's supposed to be high waisted like this or not, or if it's just on me. The skirt is weird and sits quite high up on my stomach, so it's EXTREMELY short in the back.  Not exactly an issue for my intended uses, but I couldn't wear it as a costume if I wanted to. The zipper on the skirt also gets stuck a lot. I'll probably buy another in a larger size, because it really is cute.

Additionally I ordered these on March 4th and the "expected delivery day" was March 8th. I received an e-mail on March 9th saying there was a "delay in shipping." I had planned to get these for a cruise which was leaving on March 11th, and thought that ordering a week in advance would be good ~wiggle room~ in case there was an issue. These shorts were delivered to my apartment March 11th @ 6pm. Don't waste your money on these. Thankfully I also ordered Simplicity Women's High Waisted Pompom Tassel Trim Beach Casual Gym Mini Shorts (which are a very similar style) and they arrived EARLIER than expected and fit PERFECTLY. Shipping may cost more, but they're a much better material and fit as expected. Simplicity Women Pompom Tassel Trim Mini Shorts Pants, MultiColor Print #019 XL

It came before the expected delivery date so I was pretty thrilled :) Fair warning, the skirt has no elastic and you've got to fight the zipper a little, even when you're not wearing the skirt. The material's good for the price, it is a bit see through but it's bearable. The reviews aren't kidding when they say go a size up, like seriously. If you think a size is perfect for you, just go one up just to be safe. Also I also the XL. I'm 5'9" and a little bottom heavy. Just a little. I like to crush it on leg day. That being said, with the length of the skirt being short as it is, combined with my height, and then with a bottom heavy musculature, the skirt is short. Like, REALLY short. I tried putting my compression shorts on underneath and the skirt just wasn't having it. But the shirt did fit, it's lightweight and a little stretchy, and it isn't that tacky, itchy material you've probably worn when dealing with other online costumes. Also for the price, you could always just get the set in black and white, and if the skirt doesn't fit, you could find a black pair that does. Pleated skirts are in this year so I'm sure you'll find one that matches the shirt. Sucks that the skirt didn't fit, but I kind of already knew what I was getting myself into, so I'm not mad about it :)
summary: If you're 5'8" or above this might now be the best choice for you

reviewText: Great wallet and very pretty. I love the way the cred card holder comes right out. Very easy to remove cards. There are 6 slots on one side and the other side has a nice clear slot for a picture ID,  opposite from the ID slot is another slot to put more items. Then when I unsnap his side of the wallet there is another clear ID slot plus7 more card slots and behind that side is a place for more things. The opposite side has 6 more card slots with the back for more things. You close the snaps and you still have a long zipper that goes across the top which is where I put bills. The front has gold lettering and a very pretty gold colored bow. A feminine wallet without going overboard. I love it. The dark royal blue color is nice and the soft leather makes the wallet very easy to use.
summary: This isn't just pretty, It holds a lot

reviewText:
This wallet is so pretty! The leather on the outside is extremely smooth, and I love the pink color on the inside, it goes well with the royal blue. There are tons of slots for your cards, as you can see I still have a lot more room for more. This is stitched well and stays snapped but opens up when you need it. The one downside to this I would say is the zipper-pully-thing is really thin metal. Overall, I really like it. I haven't had many wallets, but so far, this is by far my favorite. I think I may get some in the other colors :)

Thank you for taking the time to read my review. Please remember to vote below my review if it was helpful or not helpful. If you choose to vote my review unhelpful, please leave me a brief comment so I can improve my future reviews as they are important to fellow buyers like myself.

I was so excited when these wallet/clutches arrived! I ordered three different colors and each one is gorgeous. I honestly wasn't expected the quality to be as nice as they were.  The colors are very vibrant and pop, making them very eye-catching.  I have a large phone, a Note 5, and my phone fits in the pocket when there is no case on the phone.  If you have a normal sized phone, it should fit no problem! There are several credit card slots and different compartments. I didn't pick up on the removal credit card holder until hours later when I went to swap out wallets.  This removal part allows easy access to your cards at all times.  We've all been there, being that one person holding up the line at a store because you can't slide your credit card out of your tightly packed wallet.  This prevents that from happening.  I'm so happy I ordered three of these bad boys.  Such a great bargain, especially for the price.

The shipping time was decent. The product however, it quickly fell apart. The card slots ripped and I was soon searching for another wallet. The zip for the change compartment was very hard to work. Although it didn't matter, coins were constantly falling out. I recommend finding a different one.

The inside has this plastic framing to shape the shoe, but then only a very thing layer of fabric between the plastic and the foot so it creates pressure points. Glue was all along the seams, not neat at all. And the seams were wavy -- not neat at all. Its wide around the ankle and calf - great if you have wide calves, but even then it would bulge around your ankle like kids winter boots. The only good thing about this boot is that it actually has some tread, something I find lacking in a lot of women's shoes.

reviewText:
This is a really cute dress on and the seller is more than helpful when you have questions or shipping issues. The only reason I gave it 4 stars out of 5 is because of its length. I bought a Small- my normal size- and whereas it fits in the upper portion Im going to have to take it in because I cant walk in it. Its that long. Im 5'1" and 105 lbs and usually a small would be slightly long on me or fine but this has an extra 2 inches Ill have to have taken in.
Strong points: the fabric is heavy and well made. The drawstring gives it a really cute effect. Great dress for spring or a cooler day in summer.
Another strong point is the seller. I had some questions when the dress took longer than expected to get to me and they got right back to me and checked on everything. I really appreciated that.
All in all this is a really cute, simple dress thats flattering to many figures, just keep in mind that its long if you are a shorter person like I am.
summary: Flattering, well made dress....just a tad long for the shorter people

The Duofold by Champion line of thermal underwear should be a staple for anyone living in or traveling to below freezing climes.  I have a top & bottom set of these in both the winter white and heather pink, and they keep me comfortably warm in cold temps, but never sweaty or itchy despite the 25% wool content.  Some intelligent person at Champion designed them with a 100% cotton interior layer, so you NEVER feel that nagging itch that sensitive skin gets from wool - I even exercise in these!  The material feels baby soft & cuddly.  Highly recommend.

reviewText:
These are so comfortable! They are soft and fit me perfectly. I am petite and a 32C. I've ordered several and plan on ordering more. Many colors to choose from.
I recommend hand washing the padding can get wrinkly if you run it through the dryer. So lay flat to was as well.
Super comfortable replacement for the typical, underwire bra.

I am very pleased with my purchase! This bra is great for those who may not be so blessed in the boob department (like me! Yay....) and who just want a light support and seamless coverage. It is very comfortable, but don't expect amazing cleavage with this bra. It's good for when you want comfort and coverage, and that's pretty much it. The straps aren't super adjustable (only adjustable to a certain length) and they tend to stretch a little after a long day. However, it met my expectations and I would definitely order more in the future!
summary: I want ALL the colors!!!....I'm that pleased. Lol

reviewText: 32B, and this fits perfectly.  I'm planning to buy more of these in different colors.  Not super sexy, but not too bad looking either.  As comfortable as a sport bra, and padding amount is even better than a sport bra since with typical unpadded sport bras, I often have headlight issues.  I also like the low cut, because it doesn't show under any of my t-shirts.  I also recently bought a Patagonia bra (Barely Bra) which is just as comfortable but way more expensive, even less sexy looking, and has a very high neckline.  It's frustrating because I had bought the Patagonia bra specifically because it had a racer back, but the neckline shows under all of my racerback tops.  I now wear this bra almost every day and will probably get rid of all of my "normal" bras.  I've been especially impressed about how it holds up when I go swing dancing.  The straps stay in place!  Love it!
summary: one bra to rule them all!

reviewText: Great customer service and wonderful product!
Very comfortable fit, great shape and support.  Will re-order in another color!

This is the bra I've been search for for over a decade.

I'm a 33 AA, so finding something comfortable that doesn't make me completely flat-chested is astonishing. This bra is good for everything from work to strenuous exercise. I want to throw out all of my other bras, and get more of these!

Also: it's great how the straps unhook and can be crossed, which solves my other problem of straps falling down my shoulders.

Kudos to whoever designed this thing--it's the best!

Item arrived one day past expected delivery date, packaged well, in GREAT CONDITION.  I'm THOUROUGHLY PLEASE WITH THIS PRODUCT!  This hat is a quality constructed product, stitched well, and the best part is the FIT.  I had previously ordered an identical apperance wise hat through another vendor, and upon arrival that hat was too large and boxy.  This hat however, is absolutely perfect!  The sizing is of course adjustable with the velcro strap in back, but the hat is sleek and sits juuuust right on the noggin for a comfortable fit that actually looks right on any normal persons head.  The emblems are the embossed stitching in all four places(front of the hat, front of the bill, side of the ball, and rear of the hat on the veclro strap) and are the thick embossing so they actually stand up just perfect from the base material of the hat.  The emblems are also bright white, not dingy at all and appear to be stitched using machined stitching so it's precisely accurate as it should be.  I'm MORE THAN PLEASED WITH THIS PRODUCT AND CAN ASSURE POTENTIAL FUTURE BUYERS THIS IS THE REAL DEAL AND THE RIGHT FIT.

  If that makes no sense so on the face of the watch there are several open "slashes" and according to the time different slashes are illuminated together to form numbers. Like a 3 would have 5 slashes lit to make the 3. Well in the pics as you can see the entire slash is lit up. This watch just has a dot of light in the center of each slash making it hard for the slashes to look connected to see the number it's forming.
  Keep looking, these aren't the watches you're looking for.

This dress is really sexy on.  Based on previous reviews, I purchased an XL in the A4 style because I am a very hourglassy 5'5 size 12, with 38C bra size.  It fits really well!!. There are pads to hide any slippage, but there really isn't a lot by way of support.  If you had a D cup.. I honestly think you'd runneth over pretty substantially!  The fabric is more of a thin swimsuit type of material, so I'm not even sure I could get away with wearing it on a hot day as a swimsuit cover up.  I want to keep it though.  I know that there are support systems out there for backless dresses, and this dress is just too figure flattering not to find a way to make it work.  One thing to note is that I originally purchased this dress for the pale blue empire waist band, but the pattern differs from the picture.  As a result I got a dark grey band instead of a blue one.  The blue is also a little darker than the picture shows.  Again, the dress looks so good on that this wasn't a deal breaker.  I think you could get away with wearing this for a summer evening wedding or a dinner date.. again..  after you find some kind of "invisible" support system.

They hugged me right in most places (legs and thighs) and buttoned at the top, but my hips are wider and they wouldn't zip up. I asked if they had a style that had more room for bigger hips. They wouldn't help me unless I took measurements of myself. Meh. In any case, these are cute pants and the quality is ok, but you have to be a certain body type to fit in them- i.e. If you have hips or a traditional hourglass figure, they're a no-go.

Final words: Use their size chart and know your exact measurements. If you fall within their guidelines, you might get a pair that fits.

High quality boots, so far so good.
Soles have good traction and stay relatively clean. I made new shoelaces from 75" of  3/32 tactical cord (275 pound test) "para cord." I have found the military colors seem to be higher quality (O.D., navy blue, coyote tan, black) cord than the brightly colored 3/32 cord. For example, I bought some brown and white cord of same size that just fell apart.

For this to work the ends need to be melted and sealed smaller than the space between the ball bearing and the metal part of the eyelet. I watched some of the U-tube videos and started using a candle and a pliers with mismatched jaws (diamond shaped space) to compress the end of the string. Probably good idea to use a dust mask to keep from inhaling a nylon filament.

The shoes marked US 12 are actually about size 11. A "Sole" American Podiatric Association approved US size 11 insole fits in the US size 12 shoe with about an extra 3/16 of inch to spare in the roomy box toe.,.a size 12 Sole insole is too big for size 12 in this shoe.

The lacing system is awesome and second to none! The opening of the boot is wide open and easy to go on and off, best I have ever seen/used. And did I mention the lacing system is amazing, well it is! The boot interior is almost all leather, only exception is part of the tongue and insole. Compared to Merrell and Keen found anywhere and everywhere these Hanwag boots are in a far better league in my opinion. These Hanwag Tatra boots are made in Croatia (Eastern Europe) . I am very happy with my purchase and expect long life from these hiking boots.

 Update 02/14/2018 I still have and wear these boots almost everyday. They are holding up very well, I use beeswax on them maybe twice a year. Was in Iceland November 2017 and they are still water tight as I was walking around in small creeks to get to waterfalls etc. I highly recommend these boots, they hold up great are comfortable and do well on varied terrain.

I really wanted to love these boots...........so much so that I ordered them from another site, returned them for fit issues and paid return postage, then reordered them in a wider size from Amazon.  Sadly, I am returning them again (and paying return shipping again!).  I've worn them around the house for several days now, trying every insole and sock options I own and the darn things just are not comfortable on my feet.  To be fair, I have Morton's neuromas which make my feet difficult in the first place; however, the WWW I ordered in this pair allowed me room to use my insoles that ordinarily alleviate that issue and they still hurt.  There is absolutely no padding in this footbed and the ball of my foot feels like I am standing on concrete with no shoes at all.  Within two hours of putting them on and wearing them around my house I knew I would never be able to put these on and go anywhere without taking a backup pair of shoes to put on after a couple of hours in these.  Sadly, these adorable bright-red boots are just not for me.  If I were 20 years younger I probably could have worn them but for an older foot damaged by years of wearing high heels they just don't work.  Back to black...........................
summary: A+ for Looks, D for Comfort

reviewText:
I absolutely LOVE these tank tops and have ordered them in many colors now. I am living in these this summer and enjoying every moment! They are cool and comfy and with the bra shelf I don't need a bra with them at all. The colors are bright, vivid and vibrant and go well with shorts, jeans or even PJ's at night. They are also tagless which is a HUGE plus in my book. These tops are soft and wonderful. They wash up well and I throw them directly in the dryer where they come out wrinkle free and vibrant colored every time. I have worn and washed these a lot and the colors are still true which is very nice

With all that being said, I must say that they do run small. I am a very small person (under 100 lbs) and I ordered the small size. I can honestly say that anyone even a tiny bit larger boned or slightly larger breasted would likely have a hard time fitting into them. With this in mind you may want to purchase a size up than your normal size as they will run a bit tight. The lighter colors can be a little revealing so I only wear them around the house (I live with my hubby, no kids at home). However, the darker colors work well for wearing out and about with no worries.

I would highly recommend these little tanks for casual wear especially given the advice I gave above. They will also be perfect for layering in the cooler months. I really like them and plan to order more!

I hope this review helps you! :) I try to be objective, detailed and always completely honest with my reviews. I love to help others to make smart buying choices for themselves. If this review was helpful to you, please click on the YES button. This will make it easier for others to find the review so that they may be helped as well.

Let me start by saying that I have worn my fair share of compression garments, having had several surgeries and issues with varicose veins... I know how they are supposed to fit (tightly) and how it can be a struggle to get them on.  Having said that, this brand SUCKS.  Do NOT buy anything in the Preggers brand.

I am pregnant now, and wanted some form of compression leggings/knee highs/etc to wear to work, as I am a pharmacist and on my feet pretty much all day.  I ordered 2 pairs of the Preggers Maternity Footless Tights 10-15mmHG and a pair of the 20-30mmHG compression knee highs.  I tried to wear the knee highs, and even though I carefully measured my ankles and calves and ordered a whole size larger than the chart recommended... THEY. WERE. TIGHT.  They were so tight, they were very uncomfortable, so I had to take them off immediately.  Understand that I was used to wearing thigh high compression stockings at 20-30mmHg all day, for at least 12 hours... never bothered me one bit, and they almost felt nice -- NOT THESE.

The next day I tried on the Footless Tights in the 10-15mmHg, thinking that they would be a little more forgiving, since the compression was half that of the knee highs... nope.  THEY WERE HORRIBLE.  Not only was I unable to advance the tights past my knee, I wouldn't have worn them anyway since they were completely see through and almost cut off  my circulation due to them twisting so easily.  At the point I was able to get them to the bend at my knee, I'd had enough.  I took both pairs (tights and knee highs) to my OB apt that week and asked him about them.  Was it possible that I was totally out of "compression stocking practice"??  He had me show him how I was "trying to put them on" and immediately told me to return them and get another brand.  He said they were clearly not sized properly and potentially dangerous as is, due to the risk of twisting and over compression.  Again, he recommended Sigvaris brand.

Ladies... please take my word when I say to spend a little more and purchase a true medical grade compression stocking/knee high/thigh high.  Your pocketbook may be lighter, but your legs will thank you -- and you'll get to keep your sanity each morning.
summary: DO NOT BUY THESE -- get Sigvaris or another MEDICAL GRADE compression stocking...

Good looking and very well made.  Draws a lot of comments although some have termed this my "man purse" until they learn it holds a digital Leica.  Leather and stitching are great as is the canvas.  You won't find a better made small bag for the money.  Strap is secure although you may want to obtain a leather pad to rest on your shoulder to prevent sliding (not needed for weight distribution because the bag is too small to be heavy).  Good zipper which holds the bag securely -- unlike other bags on the market with inferior zippers which self-destruct in weeks.

The only concerns and the reason it received four stars rather than five are the magnetic closures on the flap.  The leather flap is designed to protect items in the front exterior pockets.  Like all magnets they have their limits and I simply do not trust them based on unfortunate experiences (more than one).  The exterior leather straps are for show only -- they are non-functioning -- and they should have been more than mere decoration.

With these reservations it remains a stylish product;  if that's what you're after.  Too bad this function was sacrificed for fashion.  Nice workmanship, but too small for DSLR cameras, and presents a risk to any item in the front pockets.
summary: Good looking and very well made

I noticed the following: The RB on the notepads were upside down. The RB etching on the lens was deeper than it should have been. The box was missing the recycled symbol, and folds were not consistent with a typical ray ban box. The sticker with the serial number was missing. The button on the case was not embossed and did not have the same backing.

I ended up returning these and purchased directly from Ray Ban. The ones from them were significantly lighter than these. In the beginning I thought the weight was a good sign but that was not the case. They also came with a brown carrying case not a black one.

I wore this as a wedding dress and got it at a pretty low price (under $20 if Amazon will allow me to say that).  I'm only 5'2" and somehow this dress was NOT too long on me, which was amazing (came just above the ankles).  Unless the product has changed since I purchased it in mid-2016, I can't imagine how a tall person could wear this.  The chiffon is see-through.  There is an underlayer that keeps the dress itself from being see-through, but it only came down to about mid-thigh on me, so anything below that will be visible.  The tie around the neck and the volume will easily allow this to fit a variety of sizes (I'm about 135 pounds).  My only issue when I bought this dress was that the seller did not include the belt that was advertised (which was supposed to be chiffon in the same color).  Instead I got the belt pictured -- a bizarre faux-leather flower thing that didn't match the dress at all.  I asked for a replacement and they gave me a partial refund instead, which was a little annoying because then I had to buy another belt (you could definitely wear this without a belt, but it's a totally different, kind of '70s, vibe).  Still, I can't take points off the dress just because the seller wasn't 100% on point.

reviewText: Love it!

I purchased the 1PC Vintage Flower Crystal Bubble Bib choker in the Green (#2). I purchased several of these necklaces on Amazon as stocking stuffers (for this price they simply cannot be beat!). A couple of things to note, it looks significantly more expensive than the ~$8 i paid for it, if i saw this exact same necklace in a boutique in the US, my best bet it would be between $25-$30. The necklace comes in those ugly long plastic bags which makes it seem cheaper but i took it out and put in a little jewelry box with some ribbon and it instantly became a chic present i'd be willing to give any of my trendy girlfriends. The picture makes the necklace look more turquoise than green (as the description states) but when it definitely looks more like a light lime green in person (think key lime pie green). Still very pretty but that was the main reason i took off 1 star. it just wasn't what i was expecting from the photo. the stones are textured (rather than smooth) which makes them look like a nicer quality. This particular one i gave away as a gift but kept several from this same store for myself because they were so beautiful. I've worn them several times for 10-12 hours at a time and they don't leave my neck green or itchy or anything of the sort.
summary: Very good necklace for the price!

reviewText: It was a gift for our daughter. She has worn it every day since getting it.

I am returning this pendant, but it did have some good points.

Pro -
1. Certain details such as cracks and cutouts are more faithful to the original.
2. Packed in a velvet drawstring bag and protected by a plastic zip-lock bag.
3. Bail is a simple loop like the original, not the triangle version pictured.
4. Surprise acrylic Christmas stocking pin was included.

Cons -
1. Swan design is off-center. Looks like the poor bird is listing in the water.
2. Pendant is too large (1-1/8 in.)
3. Background is brown instead of black or charcoal.
4. Chain is large and cheap.

There are other versions available that are a better choice. Be aware that sometimes the product you recieve may not match the pictures on the listing.
summary: Not the best choice for Emma's swan pendant

I ordered a dozen different company's mirrored sunglasses and returned them all, this is the one! And the DG stamp on the lens makes it look like a high end rayban or something.

Very pleased with the sunglasses and service! Owned a pair of these but seem to have lost them so I was glad to find replacements on Amazon!

The first pair I ordered came in a padded envelope and per the description, there was no hard case. As a result, the frame was bent and had pushed one of the lenses out and said lens was cracked as well. I returned this pair and left packaging feedback mentioning that padded envelopes for sunglasses without hard cases was a bad idea and that small boxes would be a safer option. The return and shipment of the second pair was handled quickly and professionally.

The second pair I ordered came in a box with those air cushions and arrived in perfect condition. You may have to (very) gently adjust the nose pads to get them comfortable for your own face but that takes seconds to do. For those that are curious about quality and feel, I would say the frames are fairly sturdy and on par (both quality and price-wise) with sunglasses you could find at Target or similar. They will last a while if you take care of them.

reviewText: SOFT!!! and slouches well.  I bought one for my significant other in gray and one for myself in pink.  They are our favorite beanies.

I purchased several of these as my son has psorasis on his scalp and face. He does not like leaving the house without something covering his head. A lot of beanie caps that are knit can be a little rough. These are super soft and very comfortable. I hate wearing any type of hat and even I thought these were extremely comfortable.

Also, unlike some hats, these wash up really well. I wash them on cold with my regular laundry and then hang them to dry. The sizing was really comfortable as well. My son and I have somewhat large heads and they were not too tight. I think that it is due to using a material that has a generous amount of stretch. My 8 year old was also able to wear these and they were not overly big on her.

We live in a warm climate. If you live in a colder area you might consider this as a layer under a warmer hat. They are relatively thin - enough to keep your head warm on a cool day, but not exactly snow-proof. Thankfully, snow is not something I have to contend with.

reviewText: I own this hat in three colors: red, gray, and black. The red is a classic, true red, and the black is deep and very nice.  These are so much softer than they look, and they fit really cute.  I also love that the elastic isn't too tight--it's enough to stay on (as long as I'm not bent over shoveling snow), but it doesn't mash my hair down and result in a static fest when I take it off.  You can't go wrong for the price on these as long as you're willing to wait for the shipping.

However, I'm giving 5 stars because of the customer service I received afterward.  When I wrote to them about my disappointment, they offered to partially refund me to keep them.  While this was not an expensive purchase, I greatly appreciated the gesture, and still use them almost everyday for lounging around and activities.  The other thing - maybe the other shorts aren't as well made?  I can wear these to yoga and dance and even aerial, with no problem.  Other reviews said it was a no go, but I've not had trouble, even though they run a bit big for smalls.  I wear them over a leo most of the time, and they don't stretch out.

reviewText:
...or better yet, don't wash it either if it fits you perfectly and you want it to stay that way. As others have said, this thing can, and will shrink. I bought this for a lady friend who is quite curvy, so this is one of the only options that fit nicely. And fit nicely, it did until we washed it. We washed it by itself in cold water and laid it flat to dry and it still ended up several inches shorter than before. Two washes later and there are stray threads coming undone. Luckily, none of the seams are coming apart... Yet.

Great idea filling this void in the market and makings like this for a woman's proportions. The execution is a bit lacking, though, especially for the price.

You could definitely do better with the material and workmanship. As a clothing company, what defines you, if not your material and workmanship?

Verdict: Its expensive for what it is. It's 2-3 times the cost of the average coverall for men, especially considering the problems. But if you're a woman with curves, you simply don't have a choice as men's coverally just don't fit right. Buy the next size up. It's going to shrink the first time you wash it.
summary: Pro tip: Don't machine dry this...

reviewText:
I read a lot of of the reviews first and got worried about the jacket being too small, so I went ahead and bought a large (I'm 5'4" and 150 lbs). When it arrived, I found that it was way too large and hung oddly. I anticipated this kind of thing, though, and I'm good at sewing, so I ended up taking it in two inches on each side and now it looks great.

Other than that, this is a great product, especially considering that I got it for under $20. Unlike some other people's jackets, all my patches are iron-on. I'm not sure why some are embroidered and some not from this supplier, but again, you get what you pay for and I don't mind. Give it a good iron before use to fold down the front flaps and the collar; it'll look far nicer once you've taken out the shrink-wrap wrinkles. I haven't tried washing it yet but I assume the silkscreening should hold up. I may hand-wash just to be sure.

reviewText:
This arrived today on my front porch. When I opened it, it was packaged in a square and was wrinkled. Since I'm pretty small, I bought a medium, which is about a US Small. (So Medium-Small, Large-Medium, and X-Large-Large).
  Luckily I got the embroidered version, but some people got the printed so it's a 50/50 chance that you'll get embroidered and vice versa. The Embroidery for the three patched was somewhat sloppy, but a needle will fix that. The Jiy no Tsubasa on the back was printed on the material. However, the print looks very nice in my opinion. The color is perfect! The material also has a lining, but the material is not that thick so you won't be baking alive. The material is great and is very breathable. The buttons or mine actually snapped down, but I don't know if that's luck or anything. The patch also looks different from the picture. The rims are trimmed better. When you move your shoulders, it's a little tight.
  The seller was also quick wight the shipping! Overall, this is about the best Attack on Titan jacket for the price. Hell, it's only $30! I recommend this for Attack on Titan cosplaying and/or for casual wearing.
